parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hear throughout, of a judicial hearing. Middle voice from dia and akouo; to hear throughout, i.e. Patiently listen.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
An accuser, prosecutor. From kata and agora; against one in the assembly, i.e. A complainant at law; specially, Satan.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.
Of Latin origin; the praetorium or governor's courtroom.
